text: Edvard Ingjald Moser (; born 27 April 1962) is a Norwegian psychologist and neuroscientist. He works at the Kavli Institute for Systems Neuroscience, at the Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) in Trondheim. In 2005, he and May-Britt Moser discovered grid cells. He won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 2014 with May-Britt Moser and John O'Keefe for their work identifying the brain's positioning system. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 2011. ==References== Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Norwegian scientists Category:Neuroscientists Category:Physiologists Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Edvard Moser
